t: Job 16
Job Says Friends Are Sorry Comforters
Then*p Job answered,
“I*pn have heard many such things; Sorry*ln comforters are you all.
Is*ln there no*i limit to windy words? Or*ln what plagues you that you answer?
I*ln too could speak like you, If*ln I were in your place. I*ln could compose words against you And*ln shake my head at you.
I*ln could strengthen you with my mouth, And*ln the solace of my lips could lessen your*i pain.*i
Job Says God Shattered Him
“If*pn I speak, my pain is not lessened, And*ln if I hold back, what has left me?
But*ln now He has exhausted me; You*ln have laid waste all my company.
You*ln have shriveled me up, It*ln has become a witness; And*ln my leanness rises up against me, It*ln testifies to my face.
His*ln anger has torn me and hunted me down, He*ln has gnashed at me with His teeth; My*ln adversary glares at me.
They*ln have gaped at me with their mouth, They*ln have slapped me on the cheek with contempt; They*ln have massed themselves against me.
God*ln hands me over to ruffians And*ln tosses me into the hands of the wicked.
I*ln was at ease, but He shattered me, And*ln He has grasped me by the neck and shaken me to pieces; He*ln has also set me up as His target.
His*ln arrows surround me. Without*ln mercy He splits my kidneys open; He*ln pours out my gall on the ground.
He*ln breaks through me with breach after breach; He*ln runs at me like a warrior.
I*ln have sewed sackcloth over my skin And*ln thrust my horn in the dust.
My*ln face is flushed from weeping, And*ln deep darkness is on my eyelids,
Although*ln there is no violence in my hands, And*ln my prayer is pure.
“O*ln earth, do not cover my blood, And*ln let there be no resting*i place for my cry.
Even*ln now, behold, my witness is in heaven, And*ln my advocate is on high.
My*ln friends are my scoffers; My*ln eye weeps to God.
O*ln that a man might plead with God As*ln a man with his neighbor!
For*ln when a few years are past, I*ln shall go the way of no return.
